ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would not recommend this course either to specialists or nonspecialists, for the reasons stated above.

This course allows a great deal of individual freedom as to choosing how to navigate the material and selecting a paper topic. If questions of geographic scale play any part in your work, the opportunity to play with these questions in the course will be very valuable, and Professor Dimock is extremely supportive. On the other hand, it is probably not an ideal course for someone who has only a schematic grasp of American literary history; because it is not a period study, one has to fill in a lot of the literary history for oneself.

I would recommend the class with reservations. I really appreciated the freedom that we had to choose our paper topics, and the reading selections were truly excellent - but the course overall did not cohere in the way that I had been expecting it to.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I was able to do valuable research on a topic that is close to my dissertation.
